name: Recessed Lighting Installation
description: Recessed lighting transforms rooms with clean, modern illumination that doesn't intrude on ceiling space. Whether you want to brighten a living room, create kitchen task lighting, or add ambiance throughout your home, Solomon Electric provides professional recessed lighting installation with proper placement, dedicated circuits where needed, and dimmer controls for complete flexibility.
warningSignsHeading: Is Recessed Lighting Right for Your Space?
warningSignsSubheading: Recessed lighting works beautifully in many situations. Here's when it's the ideal choice.

problems.title: Low Ceiling Heights
problems.description: In rooms with 8-foot ceilings, pendant lights and ceiling fans reduce headroom further. Recessed lighting sits flush, preserving every inch of ceiling height.

problems.title: Dated Flush-Mount Fixtures
problems.description: That old boob light from 1990 does nothing for your home's style. Recessed lighting provides a clean, contemporary alternative that enhances any décor.

problems.title: Uneven Room Lighting
problems.description: A single central fixture leaves room edges in shadow. Multiple recessed lights distributed across the ceiling provide even, consistent illumination.

problems.title: Kitchen Work Area Shadows
problems.description: Standing at countertops with light behind you creates shadows exactly where you're working. Recessed lights over work areas eliminate this problem.

problems.title: Bathroom Spa Atmosphere
problems.description: Create a spa-like bathroom atmosphere with dimmable recessed lighting that provides bright task light when needed and relaxing ambiance when desired.

problems.title: Art and Feature Highlighting
problems.description: Adjustable recessed fixtures can highlight artwork, architectural features, or focal points with directed light that draws the eye.

process.title: Layout Design
process.description: We design optimal light placement based on room dimensions, furniture layout, and intended use—ensuring even coverage without hot spots or dark areas.

process.title: Ceiling Assessment
process.description: We locate ceiling joists and identify any obstacles (HVAC, plumbing, electrical) that might affect fixture placement. IC-rated fixtures are used in insulated areas.

process.title: Electrical Planning
process.description: We determine whether existing circuits can support the new lights or if dedicated circuits are needed. We plan switch and dimmer locations.

process.title: Professional Installation
process.description: We cut precise openings, install housing or retrofit fixtures, run wiring, and make all electrical connections. Most installations complete in one day.

process.title: Dimmer Setup & Testing
process.description: We install LED-compatible dimmer switches, test all fixtures, and demonstrate controls. You'll enjoy perfect lighting immediately.

benefits.title: Clean, Modern Aesthetic
benefits.description: Recessed lights disappear into your ceiling, providing illumination without visual clutter. They complement any interior style from traditional to contemporary.

benefits.title: Flexible Light Control
benefits.description: With dimmer switches, recessed lighting adapts to any situation—bright for tasks, dimmed for dining, dramatic for entertaining.

benefits.title: LED Energy Efficiency
benefits.description: Modern LED recessed fixtures use a fraction of the energy of older incandescent cans while lasting 25,000+ hours—decades of efficient operation.

benefits.title: Increased Home Value
benefits.description: Recessed lighting is a sought-after feature in home sales. Updated lighting makes rooms look larger, brighter, and more modern to potential buyers.

faqs.question: How many recessed lights do I need?
faqs.answer: General rule: divide room square footage by 4-6 to get the number of 4-inch lights needed for general illumination. A 12x12 room (144 sq ft) typically needs 6-8 lights. Spacing depends on ceiling height—higher ceilings allow wider spacing. We design layouts customized to your room's specific dimensions and ceiling height.

faqs.question: Can you install recessed lighting without attic access?
faqs.answer: Yes! Retrofit (remodel) recessed fixtures are designed specifically for existing ceilings. They install through small openings cut in the drywall and clip into place without attic access. These work perfectly for single-story homes or rooms below unfinished space.

faqs.question: What size recessed lights should I use?
faqs.answer: 4-inch fixtures are standard for most residential applications—they provide plenty of light without overwhelming smaller ceilings. 6-inch fixtures suit larger rooms, higher ceilings, or areas needing more light output. We'll recommend appropriate sizing for your space.

faqs.question: Do I need special recessed lights for insulated ceilings?
faqs.answer: Yes. IC-rated (Insulation Contact) fixtures are required when insulation will contact the housing. Standard fixtures require clearance from insulation to prevent fire hazards. We always use IC-rated fixtures unless attic space is uninsulated.

faqs.question: Can recessed lights be dimmed?
faqs.answer: Absolutely, and we recommend it. Dimmable recessed lighting provides flexibility for any situation. However, LED fixtures require LED-compatible dimmer switches—standard dimmers cause flickering and reduced bulb life. We install proper dimmers with all LED installations.

faqs.question: What about LED vs. traditional recessed lights?
faqs.answer: LED recessed fixtures are the clear winner: they use 75% less energy, last 25,000+ hours (vs 1,000 for incandescent), run cooler, and have dropped to cost parity with older technology. We install LED exclusively unless you specifically request alternatives.

faqs.question: How long does recessed lighting installation take?
faqs.answer: Most residential installations complete in one day. A typical 6-8 light installation in a single room takes 4-6 hours. Larger projects or multiple rooms may extend to a second day. We'll estimate timeline during your consultation.

faqs.question: Will installation damage my ceiling?
faqs.answer: We cut precise, clean openings sized to your fixtures—no larger than necessary. Modern retrofit fixtures clip directly into these openings. While cutting ceiling holes is required, the openings are completely covered by trim rings when finished. Touch-up paint may be needed around new switches.

seoContent.heading: Professional Recessed Lighting Installation in South Florida
seoContent.body: Recessed lighting is the gold standard for modern residential illumination—clean, unobtrusive, and endlessly flexible. Solomon Electric designs and installs recessed lighting throughout Miami-Dade and Broward counties, transforming living rooms, kitchens, bathrooms, and bedrooms with professional-quality illumination. Our installations include proper spacing design, LED fixtures, and dimmer controls.

seoContent.heading: Kitchen Recessed Lighting Design
seoContent.body: Kitchens demand excellent task lighting over work surfaces, islands, and sinks—plus ambient lighting for dining and entertaining. We design kitchen recessed layouts that eliminate shadows where you work, highlight features, and provide flexible illumination for every kitchen activity.

seoContent.heading: LED Recessed Lighting Benefits
seoContent.body: Modern LED recessed fixtures deliver superior light quality with a fraction of the energy consumption. They last 25,000+ hours (25 years of typical use), run cool (important in Florida's climate), and provide consistent color temperature. We install LED exclusively for new installations.
